terms.ब्रह्मजिज्ञासा (brahmajijñāsā): desire to know the nature of Brahman

meaning: Meaning: Therefore, now, the desire to know the nature of Brahman.Explanation: This is the opening verse of the Brahma Sutras, which is a text of Vedanta philosophy. It begins with the word "athātaḥ," indicating that the previous discussion has set the stage for the inquiry into the nature of Brahman. The phrase "brahmajijñāsā" translates to the desire to know Brahman, which is the ultimate reality underlying the Universe according to Vedanta. This verse signifies the start of an investigation into the knowledge of Brahman, which will be expounded upon in the subsequent sutras.
